title: Galaxy S23 FE leak suggests it may have slow wireless charging speed
description: A recent post on the WPC website reveal a 4.4 watt wireless charging speed, but there's a good chance it could be more.

title: Samsung has proof that big tablets like the Tab S9 Ultra really do help productivity
description: Samsung’s most expensive Galaxy Tab did well enough to warrant a sequel, the company says.

title: Only one laptop will get AMD's best mobile gaming processor ever, and that's a huge shame
description: AMD is equipping only a single laptop with its best mobile gaming processor yet, the Ryzen 9 7945HX3D.

title: Google Maps just got a massive upgrade for drivers
description: Google has rolled out a secret update to Google Maps that greatly improves the speed of searching with your voice.

title: You won't find 100 players in a Team Fortress 2 server, but that's a good thing
description: You may not be able to play in Team Fortress 2's new 100-player servers but thankfully the game is in a better state.

title: Tech layoffs: cybersecurity firm behind popular VPN services cuts around 200 staff
description: Kape Technologies, the firm behind ExpressVPN and other big VPN names, is reported to have laid off around 200 employees. Here's what we know so far.

title: Track the trackers together: Ghostery opens up its adblocker library
description: The provider seeks to make the web more private through the power of a community-driven approach. Here's all you need to know.

title: The trailer for Apple TV Plus’ The Morning Show season 3 teases Jon Hamm as a new media mogul
description: After season two's cliffhanger, The Morning Show season three trailer is here, teasing Jon Hamm's new role.

title: Google and Bing search ads hijacked to spread malware
description: Popular ad networks are serving malicious ads, leading people to download malware.

title: Researchers prove ChatGPT and other big bots can - and will - go to the dark side
description: Researchers broke ChatGPT - what could this mean for our safety and security?

title: Canon's tilting EVF concept could be a dream for mirrorless photographers
description: Canon has patented a built-in tilt-EVF for what looks like an advanced mirrorless camera like the rumored EOS R5 II.

title: Microsoft Teams could be facing a major change for customers in some countries
description: Microsoft is officially being investigated for alleged illegal and anti-competitive practices surrounding Teams.

title: Windows 11 has a bunch of little changes underway to make your life easier
description: Microsoft tweaks notifications, revamps Spotlight, and we get our first taste of a big Start menu change.

title: NASA Plus is its free, space-themed answer to Netflix – and it lifts off soon
description: NASA is launching its first streaming service, NASA Plus, for live broadcasts and new original shows. Here are the details.

title: Microsoft and Samsung are making your work phone even safer
description: On-device attestation looks to ensure Samsung Galaxy devices are protected from the latest threats.

title: Rockstar fuels remake rumors with a new Red Dead Redemption logo
description: A new Red Dead Redemption logo has appeared on Rockstar's website adding to speculation that a remake is in the works.

title: Microsoft slammed for negligent cybersecurity following Chinese hack
description: US senator requests three separate bodies to launch their own investigations into alleged potential Microsoft failings.

title: The iPhone 15 Pro Max could be even pricier than earlier rumors suggested
description: Apple’s iPhone Pro Max-line could see its biggest price hike in four years with the iPhone 14 Pro Max.

title: House of Marley’s new buds easily beat Sony WF-1000XM5 and Bose QCE II in one area
description: House of Marley’s new earbuds trounce the competition in one crucial way – anyone else hear a redemption song?

title: Apple and Google could steal Samsung’s foldable thunder soon with rumored tablets
description: A new report claims that Apple and Google could both launch foldable tablets in 2024 to compete with Samsung.

title: Google says it can't release the next big Android update because Apple isn't ready
description: Google says it can't launch its Find My Device network until Apple is able to implement safety measures for iPhone users.

title: Marshall's new guitar amp looks like something you'd find in a loft and I love it
description: Meet Studio JTM, which definitely hasn't been stuck in an attic since '62 – but is based on Marshall's debut amp of that year.

title: The iPhone 15 might not get the big camera upgrade we were expecting
description: The iPhone 15 will reportedly have a 48MP camera – just not the one we were expecting.

title: Box teams up with Microsoft 365 Copilot in latest AI push
description: Box is adding more generative AI to its cloud storage platform, this time in the form of deeper Microsoft 365 integration.

title: Call of Duty: Warzone will soon let you play as Nicki Minaj, Snoop Dog, or a cat
description: New operators are coming to Call of Duty: Warzone and Modern Warfare 2, including Nicki Minaj and a cat.

title: Pokémon Match Battle seems to be returning as the latest McDonald's promotion
description: This year's McDonald's Pokémon collaboration appears to have leaked online revealing which cards are up for grabs.

title: Windows 11 update breaks Start menu for some customization apps – and Microsoft isn’t going to help this time
description: You’ve got two choices: uninstall the app, or badger the devs for a fix. Microsoft won’t be riding to the rescue.

title: Intel says those rumors of a CPU price hike are false
description: Intel squashes rumors surrounding CPU price increase

title: Payday 3 is getting a closed beta next week - here's how to sign up
description: Payday 3 is getting a closed beta before release, and you can register your interest if you own an Xbox Series X|S or PC.

title: Many workers say they don't feel trusted at work
description: Build trust in your workforce to help build productivity, Slack survey finds.

title: Hit the floor with Currys’ sensational floorcare deals
description: Get up to £50 for your old tech when you buy one of these brilliant dust destroyers
